## Question 1
```{r}
Pone <- function(n,k,strategy,nreps){
  
  # strategy 1
  if (strategy == 1){
    count = 0
    
    for (i in 1:nreps) {
      card <- sample(1:(2*n), size = 2*n, replace = FALSE)
      
      # create a list containing the index of *card*
      card_index = vector(length = n)
      # the first element of *card_index* should be the prisoner’s number
      card_index[1] = k
      
      # initialize the number of times of opening a box
      times = 0
      while (times < n) {
        
        # check whether the element in *card* equals the prisoner’s number, if equal, break the while loop
        if (card[card_index[times+1]] == k) {
          count = count +1 
          break}
        
        else{ 
          card_index[times+2] = card[card_index[times+1]]}
        
        times = times + 1
        
      }}
    
    prob = count/nreps
    return (prob) }
  
  # strategy 2
  if (strategy == 2){
    count = 0
    
    for (i in 1:nreps) {
      
      card <- sample(1:(2*n), size = 2*n, replace = FALSE)
      card_index = vector(length = n)
      # starting from a randomly selected box
      card_index[1] = sample(1:(2*n), size = 1)
      
      times = 0
      while (times < n) {
        
        if (card[card_index[times+1]] == k) {
          count = count +1 
          break}
        
        else{ 
          card_index[times+2] = card[card_index[times+1]]}
        
        times = times + 1
        
      }}
    
    prob = count/nreps
    return (prob) }
  
  # strategy 3
  if (strategy == 3){
    count = 0
    
    for (i in 1:nreps) {
      card <- sample(1:(2*n), size = 2*n, replace = FALSE)
      card_index <- sample(1:(2*n), size = n, replace = FALSE)
      
      if (k %in% card[card_index]){
        count = count + 1 }
    }
    
    prob = count/nreps
    return (prob)
  } }
```

## Question 2
```{r}
Pall <- function(n,strategy,nreps){
  prisoners <- sample(1:(2*n), size = 2*n, replace = FALSE)
  
  if (strategy == 1){
    all_count = 0
    
    for (i in 1:nreps) {
      card <- sample(1:(2*n), size = 2*n, replace = FALSE)
      count = replicate(2*n, 0)
      
      for (k in prisoners) {
        
        card_index = vector(length = n)
        card_index[1] = prisoners[k]
        times = 0
        while (times < n) {
          
          if (card[card_index[times+1]] == prisoners[k]) {
            count[k] = 1 
            break
          }
          
          else{ 
            card_index[times+2] = card[card_index[times+1]]
          }
          times = times + 1 
        }
      } 
      if (sum(count) == (2*n)) {
        all_count = all_count + 1
      }
    }
    
    all_prob = all_count/nreps
    return(all_prob)
  }
  
  if (strategy == 2){
    all_count = 0
    
    for (i in 1:nreps) {
      card <- sample(1:(2*n), size = 2*n, replace = FALSE)
      count = replicate(2*n, 0)
      
      for (k in prisoners) {
        
        card_index = vector(length = n)
        # starting from a randomly selected box
        card_index[1] = sample(1:(2*n), size = 1)
        times = 0
        while (times < n) {
          
          if (card[card_index[times+1]] == prisoners[k]) {
            count[k] = 1 
            break
          }
          
          else{ 
            card_index[times+2] = card[card_index[times+1]]
          }
          times = times + 1 
        }
      } 
      if (sum(count) == (2*n)) {
        all_count = all_count + 1
      }
    }
    
    all_prob = all_count/nreps
    print(all_count)
    return(all_prob)
  }
  
  if (strategy == 3) {
    all_count = 0
    
    for (i in 1:nreps) {
      card <- sample(1:(2*n), size = 2*n, replace = FALSE)
      count = replicate(2*n, 0)
      
      for (k in prisoners) {
        card_index <- sample(1:(2*n), size = n, replace = FALSE)
        
        if (prisoners[k] %in% card[card_index]) {
          count[k] = 1 
        }
      }
      if (sum(count) == (2*n)) {
        all_count = all_count + 1
      }
    }
    all_prob = all_count/nreps
    print(all_count)
    return(all_prob)
  }
}

```

Pall(5,3,10000)
